basics.name: Bianca Brückner
basics.label: Engineering Manager
basics.summary: Seasoned technical leader with extensive experience in high-scale, modern software engineering and legacy system transformation. Proven track record in architecture and cloud migration leadership across Azure and AWS. Strong cross-platform expertise spanning SaaS, ERP, and low-code platforms, with sound knowledge of both greenfield and brownfield environments.

work.name: Booking.com
work.summary:
• Lead and manage a team of 10+ engineers to ensure high-availability and scalability of critical services. (~120 million messages per month)
  • Continuously consulting with customers (e.g., hotels) to validate demand and integrate early feedback into the product lifecycle.
  • Ensuring compliance with risk management standards by monitoring and adapting processes to align with the requirements of the (EU) Digital Markets Act.
  • Develop and implement technology strategies and technical roadmaps for the next 3-5 years, collaborating with interdisciplinary experts and top executives to align solutions with business strategic needs and enhance client capabilities while having the ownership of delivery timelines and cloud budgets (AWS).
  • Through cloud adoption, prioritise API-led modernizations to improve system reliability and promote a culture of continuous improvement.
  • Embrace best practices in software engineering, utilising advanced technologies like GraphQL, ML models and AWS (serverless and event-driven architecture) to pioneer industry standards.
  • Oversee the implementation of the 'Request to Book' feature across teams, aligning with industry benchmarks, strategic and customer needs.
  • Successfully led and designed the first production implementation of multiple generative AI use cases within the company, enhancing client capabilities and pioneering new technologies.
  • Coach and mentor two Engineering Managers, focusing on feedback delivery and managing complex conversations.
  • Contribute - as EM representative for the Business Unit - on a company-wide technical initiative, Shift Left, to develop strategy and meet company objectives, collaborating with stakeholder groups. Initiative reporting to VP level: clear and impactful communicator with the ability to engage and influence executive-level stakeholders.
  • Negotiate and adapt to establish new Risk controls and processes amidst ambiguity, supporting process improvement and targeted rollout within 2024.
  • Engage with customers & stakeholders effectively, presenting technical strategies and improvements to enhance business alignment, ensuring requirements and proposed solutions are fully understood and appropriately exploited.
  • Lead, plan, and supervise team activities, delegating tasks efficiently to maintain high team morale and foster development within the department.
  • Supported organisation of internal Booking Tech Summit, where I led roundtable discussions, and also contributed to presentations at partner (customer) events.

work.name: ING Domestic Bank
work.summary:
• Directed and supervised a diverse team of 15-19 engineers across 4 squads (internal, onshore, offshore), demonstrating cross-cultural leadership and ownership of a key component of the largest banking app in the Netherlands.
  • Reported to governmental institutions, including the Dutch National Bank (DNB) and the European Central Bank (ECB), ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements and maintaining transparent communication as well as satisfying risk management obligations
  • Initiated and developed a 'Testing as a Service' team, addressing gaps in end-to-end testing and enhancing quality practices across the IT Area.
  • Managed diverse tech stack, including Java APIs, legacy systems, Pega, and various DevOps tools (internal cloud and Azure DevOps).
  • Led and organised strategic events with over 120 participants to ensure team alignment and progress awareness across two countries.
  • Collaborated with the Risk department to resolve 800 findings, establishing risk management processes and appointing risk champions.
  • Developed and implemented a custom dashboard for monitoring controls, enhancing client capabilities and ensuring adoption across multiple tracks.
  • Facilitated stakeholder engagement through regular risk meetings and weekly bulletins to maintain transparency and compliance.

work.name: Stippl
work.summary:
• Part-time developer for Stippl.io, a travel start-up.
  • Architected the first AWS cloud infrastructure for a greenfield project, using a modern tech stack including AWS (SQS, S3, Lambda, SES), Node.js, React, MongoDB, and GraphQL.
  • Contributed to the development and enhancement of the platform.
  • Collaborated with the team to build and optimize features for user experience.

work.name: Enterprise Architecture & Innovation
work.summary:
• Spearheaded development of an internal analytical platform (from scratch), to visualize and analyse API and interface communication flows, leading solution architecting. Also followed market trends and implemented the first graph database.
  • Led a multidisciplinary team to develop and deploy the MVP into production, aligning with business needs.
  • Designed the software’s architectural framework aligned with TOGAF principles, ensuring seamless integration within the broader enterprise ecosystem.

work.name: ING Modelbank
work.position: Platform Architect in a global program
work.summary:
• Contributed to developing, architecting and maintaining a reactive microservice platform for full-stack architecture, deployed across five countries.
  • Created a resource platform with self-produced tutorials on technological trends and coding education to support successful rollout.
  • Authored a comprehensive playbook to guide replication and deployment of the multi-tenant microservices architecture across diverse locations.
  • Supported company-wide program objectives by enabling consistent implementation of the platform in multiple countries.

work.name: ING-DiBa
work.summary:
• Participated in the ING International Talent Programme, gaining experience across multiple IT domains.
  • Worked in IT Service Management, focusing on Incident and ITIL process implementation across the company.
  • Developed skills in VM management, CPU stress testing, and RHEL while working with Virtualisation & Cloud Services.
  • Served as a DevOps Engineer for Continuous Delivery as a Service, specialising in Jenkinsfiles, microservices, Docker, Groovy, and Java.
  • Presented on Jenkins and Jenkinsfiles at the ING Tech Conference (Frankfurt), highlighting advancements in continuous delivery practices.

work.name: Siemens AG
work.summary:
• Developed a Configuration Management Database (CMDB) using SQL for Master’s thesis, enhancing data management and accessibility.
  • Worked for the Siemens datacenter containing exclusively military data.
  • Participated in Siemens' Women in STEM talent program to foster diversity and professional growth in technology.
  • Contributed to the Cloud Technology Expert Group, supporting and coordinating key initiatives such as the company-wide Active Directory rollout.
  • Worked with SAP ERP modules to extract, transform, and report on accounting data for internal and external stakeholders.
  • Developed automated SAP BI reporting pipeline and internal dashboard UI for the Infrastructure & Cities business unit.
  • Engaged in the company’s first trial of agile methodologies, researching and promoting best practices to support agile workflow adoption.

work.name: Dodd Family
work.summary: First working experience abroad, as an au-paur in Ireland. I was responsible for three children, ranging from ages 4 to 11.

volunteer.name: Nuremberg Institute of Technology (GSO)
volunteer.summary: I volunteered for the university as a buddy for international exchange students. I helped them find their way around the German education system, the city and bureacracy (e.g. bank appointments, registering in the city).

trainings.name: Architecting on AWS
trainings.summary: Official AWS-led Architecting on AWS training.

trainings.name: Managing People Program (MPP) and B.Champion Program
trainings.summary: Both are internal Booking.com programs, each spanning six months with one half-day per week, plus 1:1 coaching sessions. Examples of topics covered include talent management, feedback, influencing organizations and stakeholder management. The B.Champion program, specifically targets women in IT to assist with career progression.

trainings.name: Think Forward Leadership Experience
trainings.summary: Designed to help ING managers take their skillsets to the next level. Within four months there are series of group activities and self-steered online forums as well as one-one coaching to identify and build on the existing leadership skills.

trainings.name: ING International Talent Programme
trainings.summary: The international talent programme provided 3 global learning events with different sessions and trainings about personal growth and leadership skills, as well as the opportunity to work abroad.

trainings.name: Other trainings
trainings.summary:
For other trainings (& certifications) on leadership and engineering skills, see my LinkedIn profile.
  • 📚 Introduction to Generative AI (Google)
  • 📚 Hiring and Supporting Neurodiversity in the Workplace
  • 📚 AWS Foundation
  • 📚 GraphQL Developer Associate
  • 📚 React
  • 📚 Neo4j
  • 📚 MERN Stack Front to Back
  • 📚 Functional Program Design in Scala
  • 📚 Functional Programming Principles in Scala
  • 📚 Docker Security & DevSecOps
  • 📚 Professional Scrum Master (PSM) I
  • 📚 ITIL Foundation Certifiate in IT Service Management
  • 📚 Official SAP: Introduction to SAP BW

Yolante: Development program for women with a STEM background
awards.summary: Yolante program provided trainings (social skills) and mentoring from senior IT leadership.
